p: The relative interaction index of Mikania, when grown in the presence of Pueraria, was negative (RII 3M1P = −0.253, RII 2M2P = −0.379, RII 1M3P = −0.625), indicating an inhibitory effect by Pueraria on Mikania growth (Figure 5a). Furthermore, the magnitude of these negative effects increased with increased ratios of Pueraria to Mikania. Mikania showed an opposite trend, positively effecting the growth of Pueraria (RII 3P1M = 0.131, RII 2P2M = 0.281, RII 1P3M = 0.430). The magnitude of these positive effects increased as Mikania to Pueraria ratios increased in planting arrangements (Figure 5b).
